fullname: Prophet Muḥammad, peace and blessings be upon him
arabicname: محمد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم
info: The final messenger of Allah
Father of ʿAʾishah bint Abi Bakr and the first caliph in Islam
Father of Ḥafṣah bint ʿUmar and the second caliph in Islam
One of the 10 companions promised Jannah (Paradise)
The most prolific hadith narrator
Cousin of the Prophet ﷺ and one of the most prolific hadith narrators

arabicname: عبد الله بن عمر بن الخطاب
info: Brother of Ḥafṣah bint ʿUmar, who was a wife of the Prophet ﷺ
A child companion who befriended, served, and observed the Prophet ﷺ since the Hijrah, when he was 10 years old, and grew up to be a prominent narrator of hadith
Brother of Ramlah Umm Ḥabībah bint Abi Sufyān, who was a wife of the Prophet ﷺ

fullname: Jābir ibn ʿAbdullāh ibn ʿAmr ibn Thaʿlabah
searchname: Jabir ibn Abdullāh ibn Amr ibn Thalabah
info: An Anṣārī companion (a companion from Madinah) and a prolific narrator of hadith
Companion of the Prophet ﷺ and husband of Umm ad-Dardāʿ
Companion of the Prophet ﷺ who later became the governor of Basra and Kufa
Wife of the Prophet ﷺand daughter of Abi Bakr, the first caliph
Wife of the Prophet ﷺ and daughter of ʿUmar, the second caliph

fullname: Hind bint Abi Umayyah ibn al-Mughīrah
searchname: Umm Salamah Hind bint Abi Umayyah ibn al-Mughīrah
info: Wife of the Prophet Muḥammad ﷺ
Wife of the Prophet ﷺ who was divorced from Zayn ibn al-Ḥārithah

fullname: Umm al-Muʿminīn Umm Ḥabībah Ramlah bint Abi Sufyān
searchname: Umm Ḥabībah Ramlah bint Abi Sufyan
info: Wife of the Prophet ﷺand daught of Abi Sufyān
Daughter of the Prophet and step-daughter of ʿAʾishah bint Abi Bakr

Companion of the Prophet ﷺ and famous for having married 3 prominent male companions at 3 different times: Jaʿfar ibn Abi Ṭālib, then when he died, Abu Bakr as-Siddīq, and when he died, ʿAli ibn Abi Ṭālib.
Sister of ʿAʾishah bint Abi Bakr

fullname: Nasībah bint al-Ḥārith Umm ʿAṭiyyah al-Anṣāriyyah
searchname: Nasibah bint al-Harith Umm Atiyyah al-Ansariyyah
info: A female companion who washed the body of Zaynab, the daughter of the Prophet ﷺ, when she died, and participated in several battles alongside the Prophet ﷺ.

Companion of the Prophet ﷺ, an Anṣāri woman known as Khaṭībat al-Nisāʾ, or the Speaker of the Women, due to her outspokenness and eloquence. She also participated in battles with the Prophet ﷺon multiple occasions
Nephew of ʿAʾishah bint Abi Bakr

fullname: ʿAbdullāh ibn Jaʿfar ibn Abi Ṭālib
searchname: Abdullah ibn Jafar ibn Abi Talib
arabicname: عبد الله بن جعفر بن أبي طالب
info: Son of Asmā bint ʿUmays and Jaʿfar ibn Abi Ṭālib
Daughter of Umm Salamah, and step-daughter of the Prophet ﷺ
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ

arabicname: عبد الله بن صفوان بن أمية
info: A companion of the Prophet ﷺ

fullname: ʿUnbasah ibn Abi Sufyān ibn Ḥarb
searchname: Unbasah ibn Abi Sufyan ibn Harb
info: Brother of Ramlah Umm Ḥabībah bint Abi Sufyān

searchname: Umm Hisham bint Harithah bint al-Numan
info: An Anṣārī companion of the Prophet ﷺ who took part in the Pledge of the Tree

info: An Anṣārī companion of the Prophet ﷺ
An Anṣārī companion of the Prophet ﷺ
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ who narrated from several of his wives

fullname: Umm ʿUthman bint Sufyān or Umm Walad
info: Mother of Ṣafiyyah bint Shaybah
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ

fullname: Salmān ibn ʿĀmir ibn Aws al-Ḍabi
searchname: Salman ibn Amir ibn Aws al-Dabi
info: A companion of the Prophet ﷺ
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ
A companion of the Prophet ﷺ
Niece of ʿĀʾishah bint Abi Bakr
Son of Asmāʾ bint Abi Bakr and therefore nephew of ʿĀʾishah bint Abi Bakr

displayname: ʿAbdullāh ibn ʿAbdur-Raḥmān ibn Abi Bakr

Servant of Abu ad-Dardāʾ

One of the successors (Tābiʿīn) from Kufa

info: Caliph of the Muslims in the seventh and eighth centuries, considered to be one of the Righteous Caliphs (al-Khulafāʾ al-Rāshidīn) - the only non-companion to achieve that status

A successor and prolific hadith narrator from Basra
Son of Khayrah Umm al-Hasan al-Baṣri, and famous scholar from Iraq
8th century scholar of Qurʾānic exegisis and ḥadith
A prominent 8th century scholar and hadith narrator and brother of Ḥafṣah bint Sīrīn.

info: 8th century jurist, scholar, ascetic, and sister of the famous scholar Muḥammad ibn Sīrīn
notes: maybe mention that quote from nadwi's book about someone who preferred her hadiths to her brother's

info: Servant of Asmāʾ bint Yazīd
